channel.title: Pages on jaxartes.net
channel.description: Recent content in Pages on jaxartes.net

item.title: Adıyamanlı Süryânîler
item.description: Primary sources on Syriacs of Ottoman Adıyaman The linked monograph is a transcription Ottoman Turkish into the Latin alphabet of texts relating to the Syriac (Süryânî) community in Adıyaman and its environs.

item.title: Bāla’y-balan
item.description: An Ottoman constructed language World-famous constructed languages range from Zamenhof’s Esperanto to Tolkien’s Quenya to hobbyist “ conlangs”, but isn’t it surprising to learn that centuries before them, an Ottoman in Egypt created his own language and that a thorough grammar and lexicon survives to this day?

item.title: Leaving Earth is a Constraint Satisfaction Problem
item.description: I want to show that mission-planning in Leaving Earth is just one big constraint satisfaction problem. Leaving Earth?> Leaving Earth? # Leaving Earth is a independently-produced board game with lovely art that recreates a space race similar to the one between the USSR and the USA.

item.title: Mount Mountain Mountain
item.description: An Ottoman Turkish tautology Wikipedia has an article on a place called Pendle Hill, noteworthy, perhaps, mainly for being a triple tautology: The name “Pendle Hill” combines the words for hill from three different languages … In the 13th century it was called Pennul or Penhul, apparently from the Cumbric pen and Old English hyll, both meaning “hill”.

item.title: Multidimensional data in PostGIS
item.description: ADS-B data> ADS-B data # Can standard geospatial tools be used with transmissions from Automatic Dependent Surveillance-Broadcast (ADS-B) equipment aboard aircraft? I wanted to find out because unlike most geospatial data, ADS-B has a third dimension and a fourth dimension.

item.title: Python for PostGIS
item.description: I authored two Python modules that make it easier to use geospatial Python from within your PostgreSQL database. plpygis> plpygis # plpygis is a Python conveter to and from the PostGIS geometry type, WKB, EWKB, GeoJSON and Shapely geometries and additionally supports __geo_interface__.

item.title: The Ottoman Süryânî
item.description: I did my graduate studies at Boğaziçi Üniversitesi in Istanbul under the direction of the Vangelis Kechriotis. My research topic was the Ottoman Süryânî (Syriac) community during the Second Constitutional Period.
